lead_paragraph: Andy Roddick split with his coach, Jimmy Connors, ending a 19-month relationship. Roddick, the world’s sixth-ranked player, whose 24 singles titles include the 2003 United States Open, announced after defeating Rafael Nadal in the quarterfinals of the Dubai Open on Thursday that he and Connors had severed ties. Roddick said Connors resigned. Roddick, 25, said the timing and logistics of his schedule made it difficult to work with Connors on a part-time basis.Roddick was ranked 10th in the world when he began working with Connors in July 2006. He rose as high as third in the world rankings under Connors.
